body.name: Gunsmoke and Danger: A Historical Western Adventure Novel
body.description: Benjamin Bamford, once a respected marshal in Boston, is now a stranger in a dangerous and unforgiving world. He and his wife embark on a journey to California in search of a new beginning, but fate has other plans. When they stumble upon a wagon with four dead bodies, their lives take a sharp turn toward a dark and perilous path…To save himself and his wife from a sinister plot, he must use his wits…Marla Bamford loves her husband more than her own life. While her husband is searching for a maniacal killer, she is taken in by a seemingly friendly couple. She’s fast wearing out her welcome though, and any minute she could be betrayed and turned over to a riotous mob…Has her luck finally run out?Through the trials and tribulations of this harrowing journey, the couple discovers the true meaning of love, loyalty, and courage. Will they be able to escape the clutches of the evil that surrounds them and find the justice they seek? Find out in this heart-pounding Western Adventure, a tale that will grip you until the very end."Gunsmoke and Danger" is a historical adventure novel of approximately 60,000 words. No cliffhangers, only pure unadulterated action.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An intriguing storyline of a historical western
reviews.reviewText: This was a story of a respected sheriff in Boston that decides that he and his wife will set off to California to start a new life. But along the way they find things that will have her set of to find a criminal and she’s in a situation that could go wrong quickly! Will it work out to get to California? I voluntarily reviewed an Advance Reader Copy of this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Benjamin and Marla headed west and ran into trouble.
reviews.reviewText: Being a huge fan of this genre’, I was excited to read this book and visit the old west. While the writing is excellent, the storyline contains a bit of fantasy which sort of threw me. At one point, there are pages of conversation back and forth with a killer and a former Marshal, while there is a gun pointed at the head of his wife. The discussion is sort of tit-for-tat but really didn’t seem to belong in a western. The bear was another bit of a stretch but as I said, the writing itself is great.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A story about terror, heroism and redemption
reviews.reviewText: This story is about a former lawman Benjamin Bamford and his wife Marla as they are migrating west when their trip is interrupted by the discovery of a heinous crime, which calls him back to his days as a lawman as he tries to find the real killer so as to eliminate himself and his wife as suspects. There is also an old, corrupt sheriff, whose interaction with Benjamin makes him see how far he has fallen, but he gets the opportunity to redeem himself as a lawman. The story is as much as “who done-it” as it is a Western as Ben and Sheriff Carmichael try to piece together sparse clues and talk to the sheriff’s friends among the criminal element in an attempt to find something. There is a very exciting climax as they come face-face with the killer. Overall if you can look past a few historical inconsistencies and a little strange dialogue between Benjamin and the killer, you should thoroughly enjoy this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars A lawman's work is never done
reviews.reviewText: A lawman's work is never done. Even though Benjamin has hung up his badge when he and his wife come across a horrific crime on their migration west he can't help but put his skills to work. There's a lot of tension and suspense in this old west story and it's a page turner. It's a good read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 23, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Repetition is great if you're into cheerleaders cheers but repetition of every thought and 'what ifs' are aggravating! And for denying the Creator God of the universe is a lesson a wise person would never do!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 29, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gun smoke and Danger
reviews.reviewText: This is another good story written by this author full of action and courageous characters and the extended epilogue is also very good A enjoyable and entertaining book

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 8, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars From Mayhem To Peace
reviews.reviewText: I loved the start of this story but the ending was beautiful. Two families as different as night an day, but with the same love for each other that was unquestionable. Thank again for this enjoyable book, now it's time for the next adventure.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 28, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Gunsmoke and Danger: A Historical Western Adventure Novel
reviews.reviewText: This book was absolutely amazing, excitement galore, lots of drama and entertainment, lots of action packed scenes, moments of sadness and joy! Definitely a must read and lots of mysteries solved, so don't miss this one! 🎭🤠📚🐝🎶

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on March 23, 2023
